meanings.definition: To question someone in order to obtain useful information or intelligence.
meanings.sent1: After the mission, the detective will debrief the witness for more details.
meanings.sent2: The police officer will debrief the suspect to gather important clues.
meanings.sent3: During the debrief, the detective asked the witness about the mysterious case.
meanings.sent4: The teacher will debrief the students to uncover the truth behind the missing homework.
meanings.sent5: The debrief with the informant revealed crucial evidence for the investigation.

meanings.definition: To give someone a thorough explanation of a situation or task.
meanings.sent1: Before the exam, the teacher will debrief the students on the key topics.
meanings.sent2: The manager will debrief the team about the new project requirements.
meanings.sent3: During the debrief, the coach explained the game strategy to the players.
meanings.sent4: The manual will debrief the users on how to operate the new software efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The debrief with the client clarified all the details of the upcoming event.
